content: this legal text summarizes the progress of a cause involving matrimonial property rights and compensation claims by the heirs of deceased spouses the case revolves around two couples referred to as h and f van v and m and c w who had a marriage contract with a community regime and a residence clause when one spouse from each couple passed away the surviving spouse became the full owner of the community property the heirs of the deceased spouses are now seeking compensation from the surviving spouses for the investment of community funds in a house the court of first instance ruled in favor of the heirs ordering the surviving spouses to pay compensation the surviving spouses have appealed the decision and the appeals court is currently considering the case the text also discusses the calculation of interest on the compensation amount and the application of relevant civil code articles
